flatiron_tk

Mesh

This class is a wrapper around FEniCS mesh object for easy access to commonly used values of the mesh

class flatiron_tk.mesh.Mesh(**kwargs)

This class is a wapper object for dolfin.cpp.Mesh.

Parameters:

  • mesh_file – Path to the .h5 file containing the mesh

  • mesh (fe.Mesh) – The FEniCS mesh object.

  • boundary (fe.MeshFunction) – The fenics MeshFunction object with marked boundary values (dim = mesh.dim - 1)

This class can be instantiate in 2 ways. Either by supplying only the mesh_file or both the FEniCS mesh and boundary objects

Example:
# Instantiate with an existing *.h5 file format
# This Mesh class will automatically look for the `boundary` group in the hdf5 file
Mesh(mesh_file="mesh_file.h5")

# Instantiate with the fenics mesh and boundary objects
import fenics as fe
fenics_mesh = fe.UnitSquareMesh(4, 4)
fenics_boundary = fe.MeshFunction("size_t", mesh, fenics_mesh.topology().dim()-1)
Mesh(mesh=fenics_mesh, boundary=fenics_boundary)
cell_diameter()

Return the ufl object for mesh cell diameter

facet_normal()

Return the ufl object for mesh facet norma

fenics_mesh()

Return the original fenics mesh

flat_boundary_normal(boundary_id)

Return inwards boundary normal associated with the boundary_id NOTE that this function assumes that your face boundary is flat, i.e., all facets on the boundary has the same normal direction

mark_boundary(boundary_id, eval_func, *args)

Mark a boundary on a mesh with boundary_id based on eval_func eval_func(x, *args) should return a boolean

write(mesh_file)

Writes the mesh into either pvd or h5 format.

If mesh_file ends with “pvd”, writes to a ParaView VTU file. If mesh_file ends with “h5”, writes to an HDF5 file.

Parameters:

mesh_file (str) – The path to the output file.

Raises:

ValueError – If mesh_file has an unsupported extension.

Example:

Writing mesh to ParaView VTU format:

mesh.write("output.pvd")

Writing mesh to HDF5 format:

mesh.write("output.h5")
